title: "Technological innovations behind cryptocurrencies can bring significant benefits"
body:
Last weekend (July 21-22) in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finance ministers of the 20 largest economies in the world met as part of the G20 summit. Cryptocurrencies were one of the key topics discussed. The report from the ongoing G20 meeting in Argentina states that "technological innovations, including those hidden behind cryptocurrencies, can bring significant benefits to the financial system and the world economy."



During the summit, the G20 member states expressed their optimism towards cryptocurrencies in the global economy, as information portals note. It was found that innovations in the field of technologies supporting digital resources can bring "significant benefits" to the economy. The official document also drew attention to the controversial issues of investor and consumer protection.



The report underlines that the G20 maintains the commitments declared in March related to the implementation of the FATF (Special Group on Money Laundering Specialties) and address the FATF how its standards apply to crypto-assets.



Prior to the summit, the Financial Stability Board, "established to coordinate the work of national financial authorities at international level", submitted a report to the G20 group. This report presents the risks associated with ICO and the manipulations of the single market, such as spoofing or the pump and dump tactics.
gallery: The G20 is a group of 19 nations and the European Union, whose aim is to discuss the common financial policy. The finance ministers representing Member States meet once a year. G20 was created by G7, a group of seven countries that are among the most important economies in the world.
